text: You still haven't posted my favorite MM10 track. I'll give you time.
author: David E.

text: @David E. Which one might that be?
author: Beremor

text: got to hand it to you, I listened to mega man 10's whole soundtrack, dismissed the majority, only to have you point out more than one piece which is worthy of adding to my collection.
author: Stewie G

text: commando man lied, he didnt go commando at all
author: Tropices

text: Mega Man 10's soundtrack is my favorite one in the series.  It has a certain somber undertone to it, but it's still really catchy and memorable.
author: Jonochrome

text: I kind of liked this game's soundtrack. It had some good songs including this one, but I still feel that Megaman 9 had the better soundtrack.  That's just my opinion though.
author: Eric C.

text: I was literally just playing this game! Yeah I love this theme a lot
author: Kooltrex

text: Fujii was a former Capcom composer, having only worked on a handful of games, mostly known as the main composer of Mega Man 4 (Skull Man is one of my favorite themes in the whole series). I'm pretty sure she stopped composing VGM after 1993, so it's great that Capcom could get her back to contribute a track. Unfortunately, I'd be very surprised to ever see a Mega Man 11. It's been a great run, Blue Bomber.
author: SupraDarky

text: Or any Mega Man game at all.
author: electricmastro

text: @SupraDarky Skull Man was a great track, but overall MM4 had a pretty forgettable soundtrack.
author: drunyon214

text:
The Blue Bomber will have to be content with Smash for now lol.

Speaking of which, while I don't advocate it, I wonder how Resident Evil characters would fare in Smash.  Probably more likely to see a villain from that series make it, or maybe even multiple characters working together (e.g. Claire & Leon, Jill & Chris).
author: LinkMarioSamus

text: 2018: I guess you must be pretty surprised, then.
author: SiegeSquirrel 42
